edu.berkeley.path.beats.simulator
Class ObjectFactory

java.lang.Object
  edu.berkeley.path.beats.simulator.ObjectFactory

public final class ObjectFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory methods for creating scenarios, controllers, events, sensors, and scenario elements.

Use the static methods in this class to load a scenario and to programmatically generate events, controllers, sensors, and scenario elements.

Method Detail

createAndLoadScenario

public static Scenario createAndLoadScenario(java.lang.String configfilename)
                                      throws SiriusException
Loads and validates scenarios from XML.

This method does the following,

  1. Unmarshalls the configuration file to populate JAXB objects,
  2. Determines the simulation mode (see below),
  3. Registers controllers with their targets (calls to InterfaceController.register()),
  4. Validates the scenario and all its components (calls to validate() on all scenario components).

The simulation mode can be normal, warmup from initial condition, or warmup from zero density, depending on the values of timestart, timeend, and the time stamp on the initial density profile (time_ic). In the normal mode, the simulator initializes the network with densities provided in the initial density profile, and produces as output the evolution of the density state from timestart to timeend. The warmup modes are executed whenever timestart does not match the timestamp of the initial density profile. In these modes the objective is to generate a configuration file with an initial density profile corresponding to timestart. If timestart> time_ic, the network is initialized with the given initial density profile and run from time_ic to timestart. If timestart< time_ic, the simulation is is initialized with zero density and run from the earliest timestamp of all demand profiles (timestart_demand) to timestart, assuming timestart_demand<timestart. If timestart< time_ic and timestart_demand>timestart, an error is produced.

Simulation mode Condition Initial condition Start time End time Output
normal timestart==time_ic initial density profile timestart timeend state
warmup from ic timestart> time_ic initial density profile time_ic timestart configuration file
warmup from zero timestart< time_ic zero density timestart_demand timestart configuration file

Parameters:
configfilename - The name of the XML configuration file.
Returns:
scenario Scenario object.
Throws:
SiriusException

process

                        throws SiriusException

Returns:
the updated scenario or null if an error occurred

createController_IRM_Alinea

public static Controller createController_IRM_Alinea(Scenario myScenario,
                                                     Link onramplink,
                                                     Link mainlinelink,
                                                     Sensor mainlinesensor,
                                                     Sensor queuesensor,
                                                     double gain)
Alinea isolated ramp metering.

Generates a controller executing the Alinea algorithm. Feedback for the controller is taken either from mainlinelink or mainlinesensor, depending on which is specified. Hence exactly one of the two must be non-null. A queue override algorithm will be employed if the queuesensor is non-null. The gain, defined in meters/sec units, is normalized within the algorithm by dividing by the length a the mainline link (or by the link where the sensor resides in the case of sensor feedback).

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario that contains the controller and its referenced links.
onramplink - The onramp link being controlled.
mainlinelink - The mainline link used for feedback (optional, use null to omit).
mainlinesensor - The onramp sensor used for feedback (optional, use null to omit).
queuesensor - The sensor on the onramp used to detect queue spillover optional, use null to omit).
gain - The gain for the integral controller in meters/sec.
Returns:
Controller object

createController_IRM_Time_of_Day

public static Controller createController_IRM_Time_of_Day(Scenario myScenario,
                                                          Link onramplink,
                                                          Sensor queuesensor,
                                                          Table todtable)
TOD isolated ramp metering.

Generates a controller executing the TOD algorithm. A queue override algorithm will be employed if the queuesensor is non-null. The time of day profile is provided in a table. Each row of the table contains a TOD entry, denoting the start time and the metering rates. This rate applies until the next entry becomes active/ the simulation ends.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario that contains the controller and its referenced links.
onramplink - The onramp link being controlled.
queuesensor - The sensor on the onramp used to detect queue spillover optional, use null to omit).
todtable - The time of day profile is provided in a table. It contains two columns - StartTime and MeteringRates.
Returns:
_Controller object

createController_IRM_Traffic_Responsive

public static Controller createController_IRM_Traffic_Responsive(Scenario myScenario,
                                                                 Link onramplink,
                                                                 Link mainlinelink,
                                                                 Sensor mainlinesensor,
                                                                 Sensor queuesensor,
                                                                 Table trtable)
Traffic responsive isolated ramp metering.

Generates a controller executing the Traffic responsive algorithm. Feedback for the controller is taken either from mainlinelink or mainlinesensor, depending on which is specified. Hence exactly one of the two must be non-null. A queue override algorithm will be employed if the queuesensor is non-null. trtable specifies the occupancy, flow and speed thresholds. Unused threshold types can be omitted from the table definition, or set to 0, for all entries. At least one of these thresholds should be available.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario that contains the controller and its referenced links.
onramplink - The onramp link being controlled.
mainlinelink - The mainline link used for feedback (optional, use null to omit).
mainlinesensor - The onramp sensor used for feedback (optional, use null to omit).
queuesensor - The sensor on the onramp used to detect queue spillover optional, use null to omit).
trtable - The traffic responsive levels are provided in a table. It can contain four columns - MeteringRates, OccupancyThresholds, SpeedThresholds, FlowThresholds.
Returns:
_Controller object

createEvent_Control_Toggle

public static Event createEvent_Control_Toggle(Scenario myScenario,
                                               float timestampinseconds,
                                               java.util.List<Controller> controllers,
                                               boolean ison)
On/Off switch for controllers. Turns all controllers included in the controllers array on or off, depending on the value of ison, at time timestampinseconds. Here "off" means that the control commands are ignored by their targets, and that the controller's update function is not called.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
timestampinseconds - Activation time for the event.
controllers - List of target Controller objects.
ison - true turns controllers on, false turns controllers off.
Returns:
Event object

createEvent_Fundamental_Diagram

public static Event createEvent_Fundamental_Diagram(Scenario myScenario,
                                                    java.util.List<Link> links,
                                                    double freeflowSpeed,
                                                    double congestionSpeed,
                                                    double capacity,
                                                    double densityJam,
                                                    double capacityDrop,
                                                    double stdDevCapacity)
Change the model parameters of a list of links.

Use this event to modify any subset of the fundamental diagram parameters of a list of links. The new parameters should be expressed in per-lane units. Use null in place of any of the input parameters to indicate that the current value of the parameter should be kept. The

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
links - List of Link objects.
freeflowSpeed - Freeflow speed in [meters/sec]
congestionSpeed - Congestion wave speed in [meters/sec]
capacity - Capacity in [veh/sec/lane]
densityJam - Jam density in [veh/meter/lane]
capacityDrop - Capacity drop in [veh/sec/lane]
stdDevCapacity - Standard deviation for the capacity in [veh/sec/lane]
Returns:
Event object

                                                      boolean ison)

This is equivalent to passing the full set of controllers to createEvent_Control_Toggle(edu.berkeley.path.beats.simulator.Scenario, float, java.util.List, boolean).

Event object

createEvent_Global_Demand_Knob

public static Event createEvent_Global_Demand_Knob(Scenario myScenario,
                                                   double newknob)
Adjust the global demand knob.

The amount of traffic entering the network at a given source equals the nominal profile value multiplied by both the knob for the profile and the global knob. Use this event to make changes to the global demand knob.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
newknob - New value of the knob.
Returns:
Event object

public static Event createEvent_Link_Demand_Knob(Scenario myScenario,
                                                 double newknob)
Adjust the knob for the demand profile applied to a particular link.

Use this event to scale the demand profile applied to a given link.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
newknob - New value of the knob.
Returns:
Event object

Create a fixed loop detector station.

This sensor models a loop detector station with loops covering all lanes at a particular location on a link.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
linkId - The id of the link where the sensor is placed.
Returns:

createSensor_Floating

public static Sensor createSensor_Floating(Scenario myScenario,
                                           java.lang.String linkId)
Create a floating detector.

This sensor models a sensor that moves with the traffic stream. This sensor type can be used to model probe vehicles. The network and link ids in the parameter list correspond to the initial position of the sensor.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
linkId - The id of the link where the sensor is placed.
Returns:
Sensor The sensor object
